Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel for a visit; business, not so much”
Reviews.Author: uwman
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, small rooms (typical of Paris) in very convenient location near Opéra Metro and terminus of Roissybus. Lots of good restaurants nearby (unusual number of oriental: sushi, korean, etc.) Hotel is very clean, and the desk staff are pleasant. Nice breakfast included in room price. There is also an adequate bar. So, for a leisure visit, an excellent choice. However, if you're in Paris for business, the internet situation is terrible. The wireless signal is weak and variable. Every time the signal drops out, you will need to log in from scratch, including a long password and several verification screens. You need to use a different password for each device. And even when it's working, the "Meteor Very High Speed Network" isn't. OK, so the internet is free. In this case, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the Opera Garnier. Short walk to airport bus stop, and easy 15-20 minute walk to the Louvre. Nice rooms (on the small size, as is usual for Paris), very friendly and helpful staff, nice breakfast buffet. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely little hotel for 3 nights in January 2012. It was beautifully clean and well appointed and the staff were always really helpful. There is a good continental buffet breakfast and reasonably priced food and drink available in the bar or by room service.The hotel was superbly situated for seeing the sights of Paris, especially if you like to walk everywhere as we do. There are loads of cafe and restaurants close by. It is 5 minutes walk from the Opera Garnier and about 10 minutes walk from The Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: PamelaKerr
Reviews.Content: November 2011 was my first trip to Paris, France. I met up with a group of ladies' from the sewing world and we were to spend a fabulous week at the Best Western Premier L'Horset Opera Hotel . It was the best experience and and the staff were exceptional . As my French is still at school girl level there were no problems with any question I put to the Front of house staff, from helping to find a shop on a map to booking restaurants or cooking classes to requesting a kettle for the room to have a calming tea before bed. The room was clean and the bathroom well equipped and the breakfast each morning was wonderful. All the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The position of the hotel was perfect and walking distance from 3 Metro stations as well as well positioned to safe ATM's at BNP bank across the Rue d'Opera. I would be very happy to recommend all my family and friends to stay at L'Horset Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base for exploring Paris.”
Reviews.Author: LynnSays
Reviews.Content: The rooms are compact, elegant and immaculate with pristine marble bathrooms. There is a comfortable lounge with food and drinks available downstairs that allows for socializing and late night snacks. The staff is kind and amazingly helpful which makes this a terrific place to stay if you are new to Paris...even for those of us not fluent in French. Family run hotel that has great attention to detail and to clients!

Reviews.Title: “perfect if you need just a bed and shower.”
Reviews.Author: iloveaixMelbourne
Reviews.Content: clean and functional and very tolerant our late night parties in their rooms! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandretta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my husband during May 2011. Have been to Paris many times, but usually I stay in some hotel around the Grands Boulevards. Chose this hotel this time, in order to be closer to the Louvre, the Musee d' Orsay and the Seine. The hotel is ideally located in a nice side street, close to Avenue de l' Opera, and it is 10 minutes walk from the Louvre and just 5 minutes walki from Place de l' Opera and the metro station. It was very easy to reach the hotel, after getting off the Roissybus in Place de l' Opera. The hotel is traditionally decorated, rooms are small (but this applies almost to 90% of all hotels in Paris), but there was a nice bathrooom - small but had a bathtub. Breakfast was included in the price - it is stated as being offered on a complimentary basis, however, since the room price is quite high, one can think that they have included it in the room price. It was very nice, rich and tasty. The hotel was spotless, the personnel was nice and helpful. Overall, even if the hotel is a little pricey, it is a very nice choice and ideally situated for a first visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sg_tripper
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Premier L'Horset Opera hotel sits on a relatively quiet side street (Rue D'Antin) but steps from the main grande boulevard of L'opera, in front of the opera house. If you're unsure as to your location, you can always use the opera house and its gold rooftop statues as a guide. L'Opera Metro station is a 5 min walk from the hotel. The area is littered with side street bistros and cafes, and surprisingly there seem to be alot of asian restaurants nearby - korean and sushi directly across from the hotel and a sushi and thai place around the corner. I really don't go to Paris for asian food - but its there. The sushi around the corner was pretty good. There's also a patisserie/bakery around the corner - good for a croissant or a nice dessert treat after eating at a bistro (save some cash) Its a smallish hotel with room sizes to match, but they are of a very nice quality, and include free wifi. There's a limited but acceptable free breakfast. All in all a nice little hotel (as others have reviewed)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: polakis
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel with theatrical atmosphere. The environment is very friendly and the inside areas are very cozy. The breakfast is rich with fresh croissants and a variety of marmelades. The location of the hotel is absolutelly perfect as all central spots are minutes away. The metro station is a five minutes walk, very nice! The only thing could be a little better is the price. It is a bit expensive choice, but it worths the money overall. I have booked once again for this January as when you want to see central Paris and famous monuments and museums like Louvre, this is the choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: siobhanh26
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fabulous cant fault anything !!!!great location especially for shopping the decor was gorgeous my bedroom decor was much better than the pictures on the website, loved the fact that you could have breakfast bought up to you at no extra cost, the food was great the staff were friendly the bed was sooo comfortable and the pillows were spot on the shower was great and you get nice comfy towelling dressing gown also lovely toiletries in your room great value for money would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyEditor
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Latin Quarter for a 5-day stay in Paris, and after a single night realized that it was tiny and unacceptable, not particularly well located, and kind of creepy. So we went online and made last-minute reservations at the Best Western. Totally worth the switch. It was like being in a different city, too. Suddenly we were in the heart of Paris, walking distance to shops, museums, buses to anyplace else, great restaurants. The hotel was quiet and comfortable, staffed with knowledgeable multi-lingual people, with complimentary wi-fi and newspapers from many countries, yummy breakfasts with good service. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Haveb00tswilltravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I trvelled to Paris in Sept '11 and were very happy with this Hotel. The location is great - only a few mins walk to Opera Metro stop - which connects very quickly to all necessary stops we needed. It's also only about 10mins walk from the Louvre - and from there you can walk to Place de la Concorde and on to the Champs Elysee. The hotel itself was very pleasant - with decent sized double room (by Paris standards!), breakfast could not be faulted, and reception staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Married_Couple_Malta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Horset Opera Paris for a week and we really enjoyed it. The location is spot on near the Opera Metro Station. The breakfast was not a hot buffet but adequate and good. The room though a bit small was comfortable and very clean. Bed linen was changed every day. We even had coffee making facilities in the room. The staff was extra helpful and very efficient. They spoke good english especially at reception desk and breakfast room. We definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Tedfeather
Reviews.Content: Good, clean comfortable hotel converniently placed near the Opera and tour bus stops, Goo dbreakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: sallyg123
Reviews.Content: This little hotel offers good value for money compared with other central Paris hotels but I am not sure it deserves a four or five star rating. Plus points: the location, definitely. It is close to the Opera metro station and is not far from tourist attractions, shops, bars and restaurants - particularly if you are happy to travel on foot. The daytime receptionist was extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was a typical French buffet but good quality and all items were constantly replenished. Negatives: our room was small with hardly any drawer space. (Our stay was very short so perhaps those staying longer may get more cupboards.) The toilet was a tiny room so anyone of ample proportions would have difficulty getting in and out! The bar prices are expensive and the breakfast room fills up quickly, as another reviewer reported. Breakfast was a typical French buffet but good quality and all items were constantly replenished. All in all I would say that it suited our needs for a brief stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: 1Scooter
Reviews.Content: The Best Western L'Horset was a clean and well located hotel. Definitely not your typical Best Western you suffer through in the United States. The staff all spoke english fairly well. The satff was polite and attentive. The location is near the Garnier Opera and a short walk to the underground and Taxi station. What is good about the location is that the Rue D'Antin is a side street off Ave.L'Opera and is much quiter then other hotels on busy streets. My wife and I enjoyed the Lourve for a day but the crowds made the experience hot and smelly! Try to go off season. July is a madhouse. We also had the same crowds and smell at Versaille but enjoyed the site. We also went to Giverny which was excellent, Chantilly, also excellent, and Musee D'Orsay, fabulous, Les Invalides, fabulous, had dinner at the first level restaurant at the Eiffel Tower and it was very good but expensive. We found the Bistros had good food at typical US prices but the restrooms are a bit filthy and lack privacy so beware.....use lots of sanitizer. We also took a day trip to Normandy and had a private tour with Dale Booth and found him delightful, respectful, and knowledgeable. We highly recommend Dale for veterans and families of D-Day veterans. He picked us up in Carentan in his nice van and returned us there for our train. A bit expensive but well worth the extra money.www.dboothnormandytours.com

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: run2run
Reviews.Content: Great location! Very clean and comfortable rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast included was a great way to start the day. Loved the restaurants near the hotel that the staff recommended for dinner. Great shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: shaff45
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean. Very good location close to everything. We were able to get to anywhere in the city by hopping on the metro. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: genise Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were small but adequate, and had decent toiletries. Breakfast was included in the room rate, which is unusual for central Paris. The staff were very helpful, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: hartmutw
Reviews.Content: Like the Best Western look and feel or don't. I picked the place as it offered a special discount and thus did not regret it. However, the bathroom is tiny, the breakfast a bit boring and the location central, but by no means idyllic or cozy. Quite ok to spend the night there, not more, not less.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ispiegel
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's second stay at the L'Horset Opera. The Last time was over 15 years ago. Her comment was that it has gotten better over time. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and the included breakfast was abundant and delicious. The location was perfect for our needs. We were able to walk to many places and the Metro was close by for all other trips. We highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: jpa88
Reviews.Content: This review is long, so I’ll give you the highlights up front. This hotel is centrally located, the wireless connection worked great, the hotel was clean, it has a great staff, and it’s in a safe neighborhood. We returned to the hotel pretty late a couple of nights, and we never felt unsafe. We would return without hesitation. My wife, 4-year old, and I visited Paris recently and stayed at the L’Horset Opéra Paris. The two most outstanding features of the hotel are the service and the location. The individuals at the front desk are particularly nice and accommodating. In terms of service, this is a 5-star hotel. Starting with our first long distance conversation with Sabrina, the staff continued the trend of politeness and professionalism upon our arrival. To Cyndie, Damien, Maryna, and the gentleman from Columbia who works overnight: BRAVO. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from the Opéra House and the Opéra Metro stop. The train system is very much like NY in that you can get virtually anywhere you wish to go. It’s the fastest way to get around town. The walk from the hotel lobby to the Lourve is no more than 15 minutes; which reminds me that there is second Metro stop about 7 minutes away in the other direction, if you need an alternative. The hotel is also 5 minutes away from the bus that takes you to the airport. There are many restaurants, clothing shops and cafés within seconds and minutes away. Even though it's in a vibrant neighborhood, it's on a quiet block. We never heard any street noise. The hotel itself is very clean and it is simple. It doesn’t have a lot of amenities such as a pool and a fitness center. It does serve breakfast, although we never had breakfast there. We kept it simple by picking up some fruit and a croissant at a local patisserie named Paul that was a few blocks away. There are many “Pauls” in Paris and they all have great baked goods. The room was well kept. It was relatively small by most U.S. standards, but large enough for the three of us. The bathroom was a good size for us as well. Keep in mind that this is Paris so things are smaller, I’m from NYC, so I’m used to this. The hotel provided a bed for our daughter at no extra charge, which is not always common in France. It’s kind of ridiculous that some charge you to place a cot in the room. The manager in one hotel in Cannes, the Cavendish, had the nerve to tell me when I called to ask some questions and clarify their policy, that even when there is another bed in the room (e.g., a pull out sofa), they charge 65 E for the extra person (a four year old) because “we have to clean an extra pair of sheets and a towel.” How do you bring yourself to say something so stupid? At any rate, if you plan to spend most of your time walking the streets of Paris and touring, and you want a nice, clean, reasonably priced hotel in a safe neighborhood, the L’Horset Opéra is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: uschi2803
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and everything was just perfect. The hotel is near to everywhere. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is offered in the morning with high quality food. Internet is free which is a real advantage. We will come again. A tip: We found the best rate on the hotel´s own website.

Reviews.Title: “Felt more like 3 stars...”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgood67
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient, beds are comfortable and the complimentary continental breakfast was good. We had 3 rooms (to accommodate our family of 6) on the 6th floor. We had 1 exterior room that overlooked the street and 2 interior rooms that overlooked a very narrow alley. I strongly recommend you request a street view room -- they are superior in every way. Staff seemed very scarce when we arrived, as we received almost no help with our 8 pieces of luggage and there was no turn down service our first night. I would not use the word plush to describe this hotel -- there are better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: LindaP98
Reviews.Content: Very good charming hotel in the heart of Paris, located near the Opera Garnier. Friendly "french touch" staff. Rooms are clean and designed with great taste. Definitely my number #1 hotel in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine504
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly a great Best Western - free wifi, the staff were great just so helpful and the location just suited us for this trip, good breakfast, a nice little bar and sitting area. Only thing was our room had the tiniest separate toilet if you shut the door it was a bit claustrophobic!!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: searst2
Reviews.Content: We booked ourselves in the Best Western Premier L'Horset Opera in Paris. This is an upscale boutique hotel, located in an alley, close to the shopping district and cafes. It's not your average Best Western Hotel, in fact, it looks nothing like the traditional hotel itself. Tip: you can use points to book free nights at this hotel. When we travel we prefer a spacious room with comfortable king size bed, private bathroom, a bar and a restaurant, which this hotel offers. This hotel also offers a free continental breakfast which includes croissants, fruit, sliced meat, yogurt, etc. It's a quick walk to the Louvre and Opera for sightseeing. We purchased a 3 day bus tour pass (L'Open Tour) which took us to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de triomphe, Seine, etc. You will be given ear plugs with your tour pass which you use on the tour bus to hear details and history of the city. Tip: bring your own earplugs if you plan to use the bus allot as the ones they give you are not very comfortable. I did see a few young children at this hotel but mainly couples and business travellers. It's very charming and romantic, perfect for couples!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose to stay here”
Reviews.Author: John_Jan_2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in Best Western L'Horset Opera. It is close to shopping, the Opera House, Lafayette store, restaurants and transport and 20 mins walk to the Louvre, etc. The staff were all professional and very helpful. Breakfast was adequate (other meals were elsewhere). Room service and porters were excellent too. The room was, clean and modern, a good size and quiet with double glazed windows you could open if you wish. WiFi internet was free and worked well for PC and iPhone. We were very glad we stayed here as our first stopvover in Paris before we started touring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: lillian303631
Reviews.Content: I was for five days at the hotel, all requests serviced, staff very attentive, respectful, differential treatment, good breakfast for European standards, great location, good connection internet

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-appointed and located hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scooter824
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the L'Horset for 3 nights as part of trip to several spots in Europe. Would not hesitate to stay there again. About 45 minutes from CDG. Nice area (2nd arrondissement) located close to Opera House, Galleries Lafayette and metro. Room was available to us when we arrived at 12n (check-in is 3p) and beds were made up as requested (2 twins). Room was small but ok by European standrards. Very nicely decorated and appointed; good a/c. ; good internet access. Comfortable beds with high-quality linens. Just a couple of drawers but reasonably good hanging space, room for suitcases, etc. Small bathroom, very clean and everything worked well. Mini-bar was initially stocked very well but not restocked. Over 5 Euro for a bottle of mineral water. Comfortable, attractive lounge. Nice buffet breakfast included with room. Spa/gym privileges available nearby but expensive. Can't recall the exact price but believe it was 30-40 Euro per use. Front desk staff very fluent in English, pleasant and went out of their way to be helpful when we had questions. Enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Eleventh_Doctor
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here through a Eurostar package, after a bit of research and was pleased with my choice. It is in a good location for walking to the opera, Louvre, Notre Dame etc, though the Metro is better for the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is listed as 4 Stars, though I would really consider it a quality 3 Stars. It is in a narrow side street which is fairly quiet and a short walk from the Opera and Quatre-Septembre Metro stations and main road. It is an old building which has been well maintained and the lobby is warm and inviting. Wood panelling is used extensively. The receptionist was friendly and welcoming. My room was ready when I arrived before the 2 pm check in. Many hotel reviews in Paris complain about the size of rooms, but mine was more than big enough. It was classified as a single room with double bed and very comfortable. The decor was made up of wood panels and oriental inspired fabrics. The bathroom was accessed by a sliding door (unlockable but not a problem if you're alone) and was quite modern. The bed was soft and comfortable though maybe not as supportive as I'm used to, though it's just personal preference. The room had large double glazed windows which opened fully, a bonus as the weather was hot. There is also air conditioning with three setttings. My tariff included unlimited free internet access which was good and breakfast which was less good, not bad but underwhelming. I would be inclined to eat breakfast elsewhere if it is not included. There is a room service menu with hot and cold drinks and a small choice of hot meals and sandwiches, though these seemed a bit expensive. I just ordered tea but the service was quick. The television had a limited selection of channels, with only two -BBC News and CNN in English. You don't go to Paris to watch TV but it is nice to wind down after a long day. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is clean and pleasant, the staff are friendly the room was cosy and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with Tripadvisor--a great place”
Reviews.Author: bktours
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, US hotel standards in the midst of downtown Paris. Prices not low, but nothing in Paris is inexpensive. Free internet a real bonus. Many restaurants nearby including French fare and Asian cuisine. Walk to Metro and bus to airport. The only downside is that in the land of excellent bakery items, the breakfast - included in the overnight - is marginal in quality. Selection of items okay but a 3-star value in a 4-star hotel. Front desk very helpful; Lovely English speaking Parisian women. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends, especially if not familiar with Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, room, breakfast, and helpful staff were all First Class.”
Reviews.Author: greekweaver
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for walking to many museums, to famous department stores, good restaurants, and to bus and train stations. We also walked to nearby bus that took us back to Charles de Gaulle Airport. Staff all spoke English, looked up schedules and locations for buses and trains, made dinner reservations, and helped us complete travel plans to other cities in France. Our room was small but more than adequate. Bathroom was very nice. We especially appreciated the breakfast. We stayed 7 nights and thought it was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Quick Trip with Mom!”
Reviews.Author: Sonia0463
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my mother and I blindly and it turned out to be perfect. Conveniently situated between Opera and the Louvre, a quick walk to public/tour bus transportation, to Layayette Galleries for shopping or just to grab a wonderful pastry and coffee in a local pastry shop was easy. The hotel itself had a professional staff and the rooms were perfect - not very large, but are you really going to stay in your room when in Paris? I requested a change of room to include a balcony which the staff accomodated with no problem. The bathroom/shower were clean and with excellent shower pressure. The in-room TV only had CNN and BBC news in English, but, once again, the hotel is truly for getting cleaned up and resting until the next day. Lastly, the all inclusive breakfast is the only that could use some help since the coffee had been made for a long time and the breakfast staff member would not make more after I asked him politely in English. Interestingly enough, he responded to my request in French, so I assumed he did not understand my request. However, a few minutes later he had a full English conversation with another guest.....interesting, but never made new coffee. Not a huge deal, I guess. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for the location, cleanliness and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Chang_and_Ling
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a room with a double bed at a rate of USD 260++ per night. I won't go into great detail since my comments are repeating what most other reviewers said. Location was ideal. The room was nicely furnished and decorated and the marble/granite bath was very nice. Outside noise wasn't noticeable and the bed was comfortable. Staff were all very helpful and spoke English. The continental breakfast was perfect and had everything from fruit to meats and cheeses. The lobby bar was great for a before-dinner drink. Wifi included in the rate worked well in the room and lobby areas. What might people complain about? The price, but for Paris it's really not bad. Second, the rooms are small and would be crowded with two people and luggage. But, I think you'll be in the USD 450 range to get a significantly bigger room in as good a location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JudithB11
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate in size, the decor for the hotel was very nice.This hotel was far nicer than any Best Western in the U.S.The location was great, on a quiet street. We walked practically everywhere.We were on a non-smoking floor, which is what I requested with my reservation. The breakfast was more than adequate, and the available time was generous, 7-10:30. The entire staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, close to the Opera Garnier with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: pkoiesvold
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, and experienced a friendly and service-minded staff, nice room (Paris size), and clean bathroom. Excellent breakfast included, and very close to Louvre, and Metro Opera station. So far the best hotel, value for money, and we would like to stay the next Paris visit. Brit and Per Oiesvold, Bodo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret Small Hotel in Paris: a gem”
Reviews.Author: marcybeaucoup
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Horset on a regular basis for over 10 years. I bring small a group tour (mostly women) to Paris once or twice a year and always stay at the Horset. It truly is a home away from home. Amazing staff, friendly, helpful, seamless service. Pristine and clean. Love the location, but once you step in the door it is a lovely private world. Fabulous breakfasts. Great bar where we meet at the end of the day for a glass of wine or light meal. Rooms are cozy, but this is the heart of old Paris and the bathrooms are posh. Easy to walk to the Louvre, close to shopping, a central metro, many bus lines, a major Monoprix. I love love love the Horset, recommend it to my friends and colleagues. Marcy Tilton Oregon, USA

Reviews.Title: “Understandably a "Best" Western”
Reviews.Author: Britishstyle
Reviews.Content: Very helpful Staff, Very clean and tidy Excellent breakfast Great location for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - this hotel is now under construction”
Reviews.Author: vollgas
Reviews.Content: They work on the hotel's renovation during the night because their clientele would be in the way during the day. The construction noise keeps you awake. - The rooms are small and pricey, which is normal in Paris. The location close to the Opera is excellent, the view from my window with another wall at arm's length much less so. - Friendly personnel; something that cannot be taken for granted in Paris. Once the construction is done, it should be okay to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good point of access”
Reviews.Author: jan f
Reviews.Content: I like the Premier L'Horset Opera because it is near a good reference point and busy street, but doesn't seem like it inside. Very helpful staff, comfortable room, (but tiny) and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: VVRTustin
Reviews.Content: I spent hours searching for a nice hotel in this location at a reasonable price. Finally, I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and I'm glad I did! A hidden gem, this was a great find! Just a few steps from the main streets, very short walk to the Opera, Louvre, Place de Vendome, all the great shops! Everything is close by! Travelling alone, I was a little apprehensive and I'm very selective about where I stay. L'Horset Opera was a delight, I was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and very nicely appointed. I needed a second room for family who was joining me, and the staff went out of their way to accomodate us. Complimentary breakfast was great. I highly recommend L'Horset Opera. You'll love the hotel and the location!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Wasylocha
Reviews.Content: just returned from a two night weeknd stay in Paris. The hotels central location is excellent being in close proximity to the major sites and ample bars and bistros. Bedrooms were of a decent size for a city centre hotel with very a large good quality bed and fully tiled bathroom. We were on the 4th floor so street noise wasn't an issue but would suggest asking for a room not too close to the noisy lift. Breakfast was buffet style with a reasonable choice albeit with a shortage of seating. Reception and other staff very friendly and efficient. Beware the hotel map as the hotel is incorrectly marked on the map which is in reception - it foxed us for a while

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: andimari
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite good in spite of the fairly high room price (280 euros / night). The location is fabulous just 3-5 minutes on foot to the Opera Garnier.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: berhala236
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking this hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and am so glad I did. Almost half the price of the Westin near the Lourve, the Best Western Premier Opera Diamond will be my hotel of choice for Paris: free internet; fantastic shower; easy and quick check-in; excellent breakfast; easy access to eateries, Starbucks, and shopping. Friendly and amenable staff. Housekeeping does a brilliant job. Would be perfect if it could add a self-service pay laundry.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume89
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, this place is great. Very clean, and even classy. Staff is very friendly and professional. Special thanks to Cyndie at the front desk, who goes above and beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: zellerjung
Reviews.Content: Perfect for business travelers with the possibility of sightseeing in the evening. The location was perfect walking distance to the Louvre and other sites. Metro stations are close to the hotel. The staff were friendly and receptionist very helpful. The room was clean and modern. I will stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, location, facilities”
Reviews.Author: tnsc
Reviews.Content: L'Horset Opera is located in Paris's Tourist Central area -- walking distance to the Louvre, Opera, and many other attractive areas. I have probably been to Paris about 50 times on business, this time was just for leisure. And the hotel was certainly the right choice. The staff is extremely helpful; every one of them could qualify as a concierge. The manager is accessible, friendly, and knowledgeable. The bar is a comfortable place to relax, nibble snacks, and drink. The wi-fi is a bit clunky -- but does the job well. My wife and I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: smonicagirl
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute booking for a 4 night break at this hotel travelling by Eurostar. Reception staff very helpful & friendly, shown to our room by the doorman/porter. This hotel is in a very central location being only a couple of minutes walk to the Opera but because it is on a side street it is very quiet. It is also very close to the shopping at Printemps or Gallery Lafayette, and also the popular designer stores on Rue St Honore. We understood that there would be tea/coffee facilities in the room, these were missing, however on our way out we mentioned this and upon our return there was a tray in our room. Room and the bathroom were both very good and clean. Bed sheets and towels were changed daily. There was a mini bar in the room but the contents are very expensive so beware. Excellent air conditioning in the room. Only problem with the bed is that for a 'double' it is 2 singles put together so it is very large however, you have a joint in the middle! The complimentary breakfast is plentiful but does not have a vast choice. The breakfast room is also quite small and some mornings guests had to have their breakfast in the bar. However they offer a free breakfast room service up until 11 am. We think that it would be a good idea if the hotel operated the breakfast room as a 'mobile phone free zone'. There is no restaurant in the hotel but within a few minutes walk there is a vast choice of bars/restaurants around 'Opera', 'Madeleine' etc. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall Experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelbatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days and had a wonderful time. The hotel is centrally located between the Opera house and the Louvre, right near the Opera metro station. Getting around for touring was very easy from this hotel. One thing that stood out during our trip was how helpful the staff was. They spoke English well, provided maps and directions to wherever we needed to go, and really were accommodating to any requests. That was really nice, especially for a hotel chain such as Best Western. Our hotel room had two twin beds, a closet, and a desk. It was a little small, but that seems to be the theme in all hotels in Europe, Paris especially. The bathroom was a really decent size, with all the usual amenities, plus some additional like a toothbrush and toothpaste. We were very satisfied with the room in all. Wifi in the room was also free if you got an access code at the front desk. The breakfast at the hotel was good. There was a variety of food to eat such as fruit, eggs, bread, croissants, coffee, cereal, cheese, etc. and it was plentiful. The breakfast hours were also at good times so you could still make it to breakfast no matter the early or late start. I must say that all in all, this hotel was a great stay and we would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aharrison65
Reviews.Content: We spent our first wedding anniversary here. Had not been to Paris before and didn't really know where to stay. We can highly recommend this hotel for its central location. 2 minute walk from Le Jardin Toullieres which is absolutely gorgeous. Metro around the corner and you can see the tower, the arc de triomphe and the louvre from the park. Would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a central, friendly hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good business solution”
Reviews.Author: LordPippo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in BW L'Opera for just one night Good reception experience: polite, english speaking, efficient, rapid, supportive for directions/cabs/etc. Very good room: per Paris downtown standard it was quite large. Good furniture (old fashioned but ok) and very good TV set Bathroom: clean, good standard, and strangely rather wide/large. Value/money ratiop more than acceptable, i'd say good Good checkout experience: as for check in it was quick and efficient Only "minus" was about breakfast. It was included in room rate (which is good) but breakfast saloon was definitely too cramped with few seats/tables and the buffet was a bit poor compared to hotel standard Overall impression is however definitely good

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful tucked away gem!”
Reviews.Author: MYGOODLIFE
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in two rooms. Yes, the rooms are small but that is the norm in Europe. On a quiet street off of the Opera and close and convenient to everything! Rooms and baths were very clean and comfortable. Extremely nice staff fluent in many languages. Very nice small bar, and lovely breakfast buffet in the morning. Had problem with our refridge and people were there to fix it immediately. Would definately stay here again if I ever thought I would go back to Paris, but that will probably not happen. People at hotel were nice, but can't say that about the Parisians!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely clean hotel in a safe, clean area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: GumnutMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a week whilst visiting Paris and were very happy with the cleanliness, service and great location of this hotel. The staff were friendly and most-willing to speak English - without any problem at all. There is a 24 hour reception and a HUGE buffet breakfast (which was included in our room tariff, but maybe not all). The shower was clean and worked super-well and the bed-sheets changed daily (2 things that are often given poor reviews in some Paris hotels). We had no idea that the Opera area of Paris would be so clean and safe. Big, wide, leafy boulevards with great architecture and well-lit at night. A far cry from some of the other seedier areas of Paris like Les Halles. It is on a semi-busy street during the day, but you can hear a pin-drop outside at night. The 'open tour' bus has a stop almost outside the door of the hotel in Avenue de Opera, and this takes you to all the sights within Paris (for a hefty fee). Failing that, there are Metro stops all around too. It is also 2 blocks (walking distance) from the Cityrama bus depot, which we used to get to Paris Disneyland - very handy, and saved the hassle of us getting there by ourselves). Yes, the room was a little on the small side compared to other international hotels, but this is Paris people, and you just won't find huge hotel rooms here without paying enormous amounts of money. And it was very HOT in Paris when we stayed. The cooling worked perfectly. They ask that you leave your room key with reception when you go out. We forgot a couple of times, but never mind. On check-in, they ask for credit card and passport (to photocopy). We are very fussy travellers and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for 5 Parisian days”
Reviews.Author: SUAlavi
Reviews.Content: Okay first of all, Europe is small. And being a small continent means the cosmopolitan cities within its milieu are small, hence the average hotel will be....small. The rooms at the hotel are small - as in, one room fits in a table, a chair and a double bed with a tiny bathroom attached. But apart from that - its absolutely perfect if you want to be in the centre of town, near public transportation, in a safe and lively area of Paris - literally a 7 mins walk to the Opera Garnier in one direction and a 12mins walk to the Louvre in the other. We had an extremely clean room facing the street, and encountered little to no noise at night, and during the day it provided lots of light and the hustle bustle of Parisian life. We walked virtually everywhere from our hotel, with banks, shops, restaurants (starbucks!) nearby. The Galarie Lafayete is also a 12mins walk from the hotel. The staff at the reception were extremely accommodating and helpful in explaining the metro routes to take. Breakfast was standard continental but more than enough to get us started for the day. We were there during the French Open so I'm guessing that accounted for the insane price we had to pay - but would nonetheless come back here next time in Paris - possibly during a less touristy season!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: Bonnotgirl
Reviews.Content: After an unsuccessful attempt at staying in a 'different' and 'non-chain' hotel (Villa Royale) and being moved here, we quickly came to realise that actually, chain hotels can be great. The staff here were really friendly and welcoming and the room was very clean and comforable. Nice bathroom and lovely comfortable bed. The only reason did not give room a 5 star was because it was quite small, but otherwise perfectly formed. Breakfast here was good (as was the Japanese restaurant opposite the hotel). My faith is restored in hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AngloIrishRover
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel. Great location with 100's of restaurants within a 5-minute walk. Rooms lovely, good breakfast, but most of all fantsatically helpful staff who recommended and booked great restautants for us every night. Walkable to Louvre, handy for Metro (but isn't everywhere?) Ten out of ten.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGCDean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. l'Horset is very central,but in a quiet side-street, just a short walk from Metro Opera and 10 mins. walk from the Louvre. The rooms are on the small side, but we came to see Paris, not a hotel room. The Bathroom was large enough and all was spotlessly clean. The generous continental Breakfast (included) was just the right start to the day's sightseeing. Room service is good and there are various snack menues available in-room or in the well-appointed Bar. Free Internet is available at all times. Staff were very helpful and would book shows, theatre etc. if requested. There are also some good Restaurants - Thai, Korean, Japanese nearby including Le Drouant (arm and a leg). Harry's New York Cocktail Bar is just across the Opera Boulevard. For shopping, Galeries Lafayette, Printemps are 10 mins. walk as are Place Madeleine, Rue Royale etc. We shall certainly return to this hotel to get a second look at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not 'Premier' and Not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Hannah99Usa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Best Western Premier locations in Europe and I am not sure how this hotel would qualify as premier. We did have a room with windows facing the street. But, the room was small and nothing special. The bathroom was utilitarian and had not style. The hotel was very well run, clean and efficient. The staff was friendly and helpful. In the States, when a hotel is rated as 4 stars it is usually something special. I would not rate our hotel room as special. The location was excellent. We were able to walk or take the Metro anyplace.

Reviews.Title: “PAY ATTENTION THAT YOU ARE NOT BOOKING A ROOM WITH WINDOW OPENING against a wall”
Reviews.Author: silverJACK
Reviews.Content: The place is clean and looks quite and pritty, anyway there are a couple of rooms per floor, that have the windows opening against a wall and the fresh air is vicious and full of gas. ask clearly before! wich is the status of yr room before yr confirmation and/or your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rwest1987
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend visit to Paris. I booked this hotel through Eurostar with the aim of finding a hotel in a good location. When i arrived at the hotel i was astounded at how good the service was. I was greeted from my taxi by the concierge who carried my luggage to the reception desk where i was given a warm and friendly greeting by the receptionist who was only too happy to help. When i got to my room, (which was located on the 5th floor) I was delighted with the decor, clearly some care had been taken into making this place look and feel authentic. There was a very comfortable queen size bed, a plasma television, minibar and several guides and magazines about Paris. All of these guides and magazines were multilingual which was helpful. There was also a small card on the desk telling me the name of the maid, which in itself is a nice little touch, but when it is also written in English it makes you wonder how on earth they knew that. The bathroom was marble effect throughout and the shower was outstanding for a bath/shower combination. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast with a range of pastries, cereals, fruit, cold cuts of meat and cheese. I would highly recommend the fruit muesli as it was very good. There was also a range of multiligual newpapers for you to take and read. Other things that impressed me was the free wi'fi in the hotel, the quality of the room service, the politeness of the staff and the general attention to detail. The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. It is a 2 minute walk from the Opera house and metro line and a short 10 minute walk from the Louvre. The only things that slightly disappointed me about the hotel were, the bathroom door as it was on a slider and didn't have a lock. The lift was fairly slow as well, i was also given a small electric shock whilst pressing the call button on the fifth floor. Overall this hotel is absolutely fantastic and represents great value for money, I plan on returning in the summer to make the most of Paris when the weather is less inclement.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly helpful staff and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RachelK23
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended-only a short stroll (less than 10 minutes) from the Louvre. Only a block away from the Garnier Opera house, and mere feet from a metro station. This comfortable hotel is in the best location possible for gettng to all the major sightseeing attractions in this spectacular city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!! Great Location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlNelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel location was great, Near train and bus stops, near shuttle to and from airport, down the street from the Opéra Garnier , in walking distance from the Louvre Museum. Great Location, My husband and I used Paris Transit system to the max, riding the bus and train all over Paris. The hotel staff was great, every question we asked, they answered, very helpful staff ( map direction, cab service, room service ) The room was small but amazing, the bathroom was outstanding, from the fixture and tub, to the lighting. They really made use of a small room.Most days my husband and I came in late and left early. A perfect spot!!! Breakfast was different but its the French way of doing breakfast, we were in Paris, Toast bread your choice, tea of course, coffee, boil eggs, ham and cheese, danish and muffins. No bacon, fried eggs or scammble eggs, or any other meat. but it was good enough. If I was to go back again I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at a Four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AverageGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early September 09 and were so impressed by the service we received. On the reception desk you will find a woman called 'Aurore' who is very knowledgeable about the surrounds and speaks perfect english. She can recommend where to eat, what to do, and can help with anything. She even helped us arrange the next leg of our journey into Italy. The hotel itself is quite charming, the rooms are small but decorated very nicely and very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Our room had opening doors onto a tiny balcony. Breakfast is good and the bartender was very friendly and happy to chat. The hotel location is OK - it would be a real long walk to the Eiffel Tower or Champs E, and you can't actually see the Tower from the hotel - but you can walk to the Louvre in under 10 minutes (it's just down the street), and the Opera and lots of shops and restaurants are just around the corner, including McDonalds and Pizza Hut if you have kids or limited funds to eat! Galleries Lafayette (the huge shopping mall) is also around the corner. And if you're taking any bus tours with Cityrama they are also just down the road. The hop-on hop-off bus stop is also a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Service minded hotel next to the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Punch5
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, just beside the Opera in a very quiet street. Metro is close. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff very friendly and helpful. We were very happy indeed and would gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - pitty about the lack of daylight in our room”
Reviews.Author: Calm09
Reviews.Content: Don't accept a rear room as our room looked into a small light shaft which turned day into night. There was virtually no daylight - thus the low score. Ensure that you get a front room and all will be well. The hotel was very good, comfortable bed, clean, friendly and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: vezevass
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel coming from aix-en-provence. It ia clean, quiet and cozy hotel. The staff is very kind and helpful. The hotel is located at an excellent spot very convenient ot move around Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roscomain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location was great - we got the Roissybus from Charles de Gaulle Airport and it takes you directly to Rue Scribe, beside Opera, a couple of hundred yards from the Hotel. Staff very welcoming and informative and had good English and willing to use it. Room and ensuite very clean and comfortable. Heating and cooling system worked well. TV had BBC News and CNN in English, also Italian, German and of course French Channels. Free WiFi was available throughout. Lounge area was small but comfortable. Breakfast had a good variety and perfectly adequate. Less than 10 mins walk to the Louvre, 5 mins to Galeries Lafyette (Department Store).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rather 3-star”
Reviews.Author: Boldizsar
Reviews.Content: Close to Opera in a friendly area with restaurants, cafes and shops. In a quiet small rue. Global best western style with small hall, small rooms, narrow, dark passages to rooms, creaking floors. Breakfast is simple but OK. For a short business trip it is good but not for couples, romance, charme or authenticity.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay with special service”
Reviews.Author: SUZSVE
Reviews.Content: My second stay at BW L'Horset Opera in Paris was with equal enjoyment. My adult daughter accompanied me and we shared a twin room which could have been larger. However, it was equipped with comfortable beds, excellent AC and a shower/bath combination. Better ventilation in the bathroom, appropriate hair dryer, cooked breakfast and larger size room would have given this a 5 star rating. Our location on the 6th floor was very quiet despite being close to the lift. As already noted it is around the corner from the Opera stop on the metro and several bus stops to get around the city. We arrived via Gare du Nord which is located easily by changing to line 7 or directly via bus location near the opera house. Quite convenient for the hop on and off buses too. Staff at the hotel is very helpful with excellent English and service which is professional but very courteous. Included breakfast was sufficient with delicious croissants, yogurts, juice, coffee/tea, hard boiled eggs and cold meats. Everything was clean and replenished quickly. Luggage may be safely left during the day if a train or flight is later than check out. Walking distance to the Louvre takes about 15 minutes at a leisurely pace. I was informed by staff that the Internet was free although we did not bring a lap top.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite small hotel in the heart of Paris, beloved for details that count.”
Reviews.Author: marcybeaucoup
Reviews.Content: I conduct small tours for women and the Horset is my favorite: GREAT central location, marvelous staff, cozy charm, generous breakfasts, lovely little bar/snacks. Having checked out many others, this is THE one I love and return to again and again. Invisible & impeccable service, lovely rooms, run by a family committed to excellence. I return every year and love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...........”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Have been visiting this Hotel quite often and have been a regular since the 1st visit here. The location firstly deserves particular mention. The freindly Hotel staff deserve a special mention, they recognise you if you visit them again and make your check-in and check-out a breeze which. The breakfast spread is good and has a variety of options not very extensive but good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in the L'Horset Opera hotel”
Reviews.Author: INFO260669
Reviews.Content: I have spent a wonderful week in this hotel. The hotel has a great location very close to Opera Garnier and Louvre. My room was very quiet, cozy and elegant, and the staff was very kind and helpful. I'll be happy to return to tjis hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: David-and-crew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my wife as part of our anniversary. I had wanted a small comfortable hotel that was well situated for seeing central Paris. Horest Opera was ideal. A nice small hotel tucked away on a quiet street just a few hundred feet away from the Opera House and the metro. 5-10 minute walk to the Louvre or Jardin de Tuilleries (depending on your walking pace) and easy reach of shops, restaurants etc.The room was a reasonable size for two people with a nice bathroom, good air conditioning system (it was 28 degrees on the first day there).Staff very pleasant and helpful.Breakfast - Standard continental hotel offering of fruit, pastries etc. Nice enough but when in Paris we always go out for breakfast if the weather allows for sitting outside so didn`t actually eat at the hotel.4th stay in Paris and we`d certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “December”
Reviews.Author: rabbitman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in December and was very impressed, especially for the price. All of the staff were very helpful and spoke good English. The room was clean, modern and in full working order with a full sized safe and nice bathroom. The breakfast was good, as was the location. All in all the hotel deserves its four stars. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: FrequentPayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in early June 2008. We booked 2 rooms at the hotel's website and were positively surprised to receive adjoining rooms, which was very handy when traveling exceptionally with two teenagers. The rooms are not large but adequate, bathrooms clean and tidy. 4* Front desk staff was very friendly and multilingual (at least French, English and German were covered at that time). The breakfast room is small, but so is the hotel, so there was no rush in the mornings. 4* The location is great with a short walk to the metro (Opera). We arrived at Gare de l'Est and took a taxi, which was obviously a mistake: the metro would have been quicker. Nice restaurants and bars in the vicinity (we ate once at the Asian across the street, very good). In short, a perfect choice for a weekend in Paris, maybe a bit pricey when compared to some other 4 star hotels, but the quiet location is well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: thesean365
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel, we stayed for two nights and did not find any faults. Staff were helpful and friendly (plus spoke very good English). Our room was of reasonable size although the bathroom was a little on the small side, but was clean and fresh. Noise levels were low at night as well. We had to ask for tea and coffee making facilities in the room and the staff gladly provided them. Location wise, the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Louvre, with plenty of cafe's around the hotel. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, quiet little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off the Avenue de l'Opera. Its location is very handy with the Rue de Rivoli (for the Louvre) at one end of Avenue de l'Opera and Boulevard Haussmann (for shopping) at the other end. We tended to catch a bus to the Louvre end as it is a steady 15 minute walk. The metro is also close by. The hotel itself is lovely - small with everything in excellent order. The room was compact but this is par for the course in Paris. We overlooked the street which was very quiet and peaceful. As to the mod cons in the room, the air conditioning was working perfectly and the internet access was problem free. I would definitely stay here again. Fun things we did during this trip included: - a Segway tour around Paris hotspots - lunch at Le Café Marly which is in the Richelieu wing of the Louvre Palace (its terrace is on the Cour Napoléon and overlooks the Pyramid). Walk in like you own the place and you will be sure to get a table - however busy it looks - café-crème at the Musée d'Orsay...head to the top of the Museum, near the Impressionist galleries and there you will find the Café des Hauteurs. There is a huge clock which faces out onto the Seine and on a clear day you have a great panoramic view - we lunched out at the Obelisque which is situated inside the Crillon Hotel on Place de la Concorde. Yes it is at a price but worth every lip smackingly delicious morsel. It is worth a visit just for the ambience alone. I felt like a pampered princess and I am still dreaming of my meal!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteM
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit, our first only a few months ago and we were impressed enough to go back. This time our allocated room was on the 6th floor (attic) and was very light quite different from the dark room we had in November. Bathroom layout also much better. Lots of good places to eat nearby. All in all another good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KariMetzger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, in mid march of 08. The hotel is clean, and looks nice in the lobby, and we were happy enough with our room, which featured a HUGE king bed and enormous bathroom. I do agree with the woman who said the decor was dark, but we did think it interesting, as it was in a bit of the 'old style' tapestry - you could envision yourself in bed under the old style of curtains and canopies, if you were inclined. The breakfast was good - we've enjoyed better at the Mercure, with more options, but it was satisfying enough. The 'snacks' you can get in the lobby dining area are outrageously expensive, so go walking to find food if you can. Similarly, room service is no deal, with the tip adding onto every bill. The maids were very kind and gracious - rarely do I compliment the maid service, but they were truly very nice, even though we chose not to make use of their services (save the environment and all). The internet access fee was expensive - we didn't like that too much, and location wise, it was a little farther from the 'hub' than we would have liked, but the metro is so good, it doesn't matter. The staff seemed less than eager to help us poor non-French speakers (although we do limp by in French adequately). Other than that, it is Paris, and it is a clean room. I wouldn't steer you away from it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurstYourBubble
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome this evening. We stayed at the Best Western. It was a beautiful hotel, very handy for the metro (between Opera and Quatre Septembre). It is down a nice quiet road called Rue D'Antin a few hundred yards from the magnificent Opera house. There wasn't a sound at night. We were on the fifth floor. Staff were courteous and polite. The breakfast was nice. It was continental style - not what Irish people normally like but still very good for what it was. Lovely bread, cakes, ham and fresh fruit as well. I have only one minor complaint. When I got the bill, there was about €35 worth of mini bar items on the bill that we never even used. This was rectified however. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. It is lovely. The rooms are gorgeous and so is the lobby and bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet location in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ClareandChris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the Avenue d'Opera very conveniently for the metro, taxis and buses. It is within easy walking distance of the Louvre and other central sights. The hotel was amazingly quiet - we had a fifth floor room and slept with the window open (it was very hot with the window closed). The room was clean, with a huge six foot bed; bathroom tiled and spotless, good power shower and all the usual freebies. Welcome addition was a bathrobe and a free safe (credit card used as a swipe card). Breakfast was continental but all very fresh products, restocked regularly. Staff were very helpful indeed both in the breakfast area and on reception. Reception staff speak excellent English. Lifts are very slow - but hey, you are on holiday, who cares about the speed of the lifts! Lots of places to eat on the Avenues which spin out from the Opera (within five minutes) but ask at reception if you want a small and intimate restaurant - they will call ahead and book for you. We really enjoy Paris and can recommend the Seine Dinner Cruise - Bateaux Parisians - the food was outstanding, the price included two bottles of wine and an apperitif, excellent waiter service and live music. The perfect place to propose if you have that in mind! We also took in a show and can recommend the Lido for spectacular fun. This year we travelled out to La Defense which was fascinating with innovative buildings and eirily quiet, you just have to experience it as a contrast to the city centre. Don't bother with the Paris Visite card unless you want to cram in every museum in a very short time - buy a set of 10 metro tickets (which you can use on buses), you can get these at metro stations and at the Gare de Nord (if you are sensibly arriving on Eurostar - which we cannot recommend highly enough). Have fun and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: xleo68
Reviews.Content: Excelent choice in Paris, as part of owr honeymoon. Great location, as a base center for Paris: in the middle of Paris, close to the metro and bus stops, restaurants, shopping... Rooms really small but confortable, clean, quiet, nicely decorated. Definitively recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel at a really nice location!”
Reviews.Author: nimanos
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife at L'Horset Opera hotel for 3 nights in early January 2008, right at the start of the winter Sales period in Paris. Our room (on the 3rd floor, facing rue D' Antin) was really fine, clean and very comfortable. It was warmly decorated, well heated and the area is really quiet though it is so close to the Opera Avenue. The bathroom was very clean and hot water was available at all times. The bed (two beds in fact, forming one double) was very comfortable. Breakfast was fine with fresh chocolate and raisin croissants, baguettes and everything a really decent buffet can have and of course coffee and fresh orange juice. The hotel staff is really great and helpful and they speak English very well. At the reception you can purchase tickets for various attractions (like tickets to Disneyland resort or the Open tour busses for no extra charge). Wifi prices are kind of high(starting from 5 Euros for 45 mins to 45 Euros for 3 days), though I could use their pc to print our boarding passes for no charge. The location is excellent, really close to Louvre, La Concorde, Place Vendome, and hot spots for shopping (Rue Honore, Galleries Lafayette and Printemps) and of course the Opera (3 mins walk) where you can find a lot of cafes and brasseries. There are three metro Stations really close the hotel (Opera, Pyramides and Quatre Septembre), a lot of bus stations (that can take you to Montmarte or Saint Germain) and one stop of the Open tour Bus (Green line - visits all the places one wants to visit). Another thing that we found really useful is that there is a bus (Roissy Bus) that takes you straight from CDG to the Opera and back in 45-50 min drive (ticket 8,60Euros available from the driver too). I believe that there is also one that takes you to Orly at the same place but I'm not sure about it. We had a really nice time at Paris and we certainly would choose this hotel again for our next stay! Nimanos Athens, Greece

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_and_Mike
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the L'Horset Opera for 5 nights during Christmas (23rd to 28th December 2007) and had a fabulous time. The hotel room was on the small side but we had a large kingsize bed with clean crisp white sheets and it was very comfortable. The room was very clean and the air conditioning/temperature control worked very well. The room was also very quiet. We stayed on the 6th floor which was a none smoking floor. My only complaint would be the lack of drawer space as I prefer to unpack everything rather than live out of the suitcase. Also the bath was on the small side but had an over bath shower and also a hand held shower with constant hot water. The room was perfect after a days sightseeing. As mentioned by other reviewers, the location was excellent, very close to the Galleries Lafayette and of course the Opera. We travelled around on foot (Concorde and Place Vendome were within easy walking distance) and also used the Metro - we purchased a 5 day ticket from the Tourist Information and we got some good maps from them too. The facilities in the hotel were fine, breakfast as expected, continental with freshly squeezed orange juice. The staff were very friendly and helpful and were able to deal with all our requests (kingsized bed, extra coathangers, toast with breakfast and booking taxis) and I am sure they would have been able to assist with other things had we required them. This hotel does not have any additional facilities such as a pool or a gym, but has a relaxed atmosphere and a more personal touch than some of the larger hotels. We took a taxi from Chales de Gaulle and it cost around 40 euros (50 euros on the way back due to traffic). We had originally planned to use the train but a lot of people were stood up and we had a lot of bags and just thought a taxi would be the easiest option. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayare14
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights – Dec 14-17th. Booked on package with Eurostar – Damn their move to St Pancras. For anyone coming up from the South of England it's a pain. Beautiful building, but not a patch on Waterloo for ease of use. A most user unfriendly place with lousy sign-age. Thank goodness the staff are obliging. Anyway, back to the hotel. Excellent location in the centre of the Opera district of Paris. However, taxi driver didn't know where it was. After many about turns, and reversing after going down a one way street the wrong way, he found it. (Not in the same league as London cabbies). Very welcoming and helpful English speaking staff. Size of room was average with fair sized wardrobe with built-in safe. Good sized dressing table with drawers for storage. Very comfortable bed, but only one armchair. Good range of international programmes on TV with speaker in bathroom. Very clean and well appointed bathroom, with bath, with fixed and hand held shower overhead. Good range of toiletries. Towels and sheets changed daily. Heating only by air conditioning unit. Very quiet, but if fan turned off, no heating. But with outdoor temperatures at around 0º c, rooms held heat well, except for our friends on the top (6th) floor. No kettle or welcome tray, but 24hr room service for light meals and snacks. The included continental breakfast arrangement was very nice, with a good range of food to choose from. The only problem, was a horrible smell on entering our room on the fifth floor. It was either the drains or the air-con. Not bad enough to spoil our stay, but would have asked for a change of room had we stayed any longer. To be fair, Paris can be a pretty smelly place anyway. I often wondered why Parisians are so keen on smoking fowl smelling cigarettes and eating so much garlic. It covers a multitude of sins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeanettefromGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights 3rd - 6 November 2007. Hotel is in a really good and quiet position. Breakfast was adequate usual continental fare although the breakfast room was pretty tiny. Room was nice although a little dark for my taste. Bathroom okay with separate toilet area which was fine if you were small but if you were slightly larger it would be a tight squeeze. The staff are very good, extremely polite and accommodating. All in all a good hotel and we would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karenthelibrarian
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. It had everything. Breakfast was good, with cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc. The staff were nice. The room was good. The twin beds were kind of close, but we were in Paris. (And the hotel rooms are small in Paris.) The bathroom was ok. The tub was hard to get out of. (I am disabled and my Mom is older, if that makes a difference.) We had an ok time in Paris, but won't be going back soon. It was raining when we were there, as well as a taxi strike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JamesRye
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on the basis of the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We will definitely be going there again. The hotel itself was excellent. It was clean, luxurious for its class, comfortable, and very friendly. The rooms have air-conditioning. The staff spoke English fluently and were very helpful. We really gained the impression that we were important guests rather than an inconvenient annoyance interrupting the staff's day. The location was just what we wanted. The hotel is located in a quiet street near one of the main boulevards. The art galleries, Tuilleries, and the river were within easy walking distance. There is good shopping near by, and if you want it, the Opera House is just round the corner. There were plenty of French cafes in the area and a full range of Japonese, Korean, and Italian restaurants. If you only have time for one museum, the Musee d'Orsee is a must. Entrance to the Musee d'Orsee is free on the first Sunday of every month, but make sure you get there early. Admire the Louvre buildings from the outside, but don't bother fighting the crowds inside unless there is something specific that you want to see. The Picasso Museum is a hidden gem, and well worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireMuse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed. As already described by many, the hotel staff are wonderful and extremely helpful. Our room, although small, was very comfortable and quiet - we had enormous difficulty getting out of bed in the morning! Breakfast was very good - although Continental, you can ask for toast and also, for a supplement, omelettes, etc. The location was brilliant in the respect of easy walking distance to the Louvre, Musée de l’Orangerie and even the Musée d'Orsay. There were also a huge choice of restaurants in close proximity and we were truly spoilt for choice. A real gem of a hotel and one I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avenger999
Reviews.Content: If you can't decide whether to stay on the left or right bank, and you want a peaceful night's sleep with breakfast included in the room rate, choose this hotel. Situated in a quiet side street off Avenue de l'Opera, It's just ten minutes walk to Galeries Lafayette in one direction and about 15 minutes to the Left Bank in the other. The hotel itself is charming. Unlike many hotels where the lobby is an impersonal space, L'horset has a softly-lit seating area to your right with two large comfy sofas, potted plants and even a collection of books where you can sit and relax after a day's hard sight-seeing. The barman will bring coffee or other drinks here, or - if you can manage without a sofa - you can sit in the bar which is just as cosy and even serves light meals if you are too tired to go out. It's not great cuisine but it's a lot better than the burgers and chips served up by many a bar in British hotels. Again, unlike many hotels where all the expense has gone on decorating the public areas, this hotel's charm doesn't stop at the elevator doors. The upstairs corridors have fabric-lined walls above wood panelling and this continues into the bedrooms, all of which have their own fabric style. Ours was Willow Pattern in red and ochre. The bathroom was completely tiled in marble, both walls and floor. The overbath showerhad both a fixed head and a handset, very handy for hairwashing. I do have a few quibbles. The bedrooms are small - some might say poky - and there is little closet space. This may not matter if you are staying just a couple of nights, but 4 double coat-hangers seems a little stingy for a hotel claiming to be 4-star. The face cloths were thin, disposable mitts - rather like the ones for polishing shoes. Terry ones would have been more approprate. We asked for tea-making facilities (as offered) and while these were provided, the supplies of milk, etc were never replenished. Nor were there any biscuits. The room had a slight smell to it as though someone had been smoking, despite the fact that it was a non-smoking floor. We felt that maybe the bedcover and curtains were in need of a clean. However, these are small complaints in what was otherwise a very pleasant experience. Other reviewers have mentioned the friendly staff and I can only add to that. We were impressed by the calm efficiency and the way everything was done with the minimum of fuss and dispruption. We would cerrtainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - can't go wrong with this one”
Reviews.Author: Tukas
Reviews.Content: With a 6 month old baby in tow we stayed for 4 nights and cannot speak highly enough of the effort the hotel made to make us comfortable. From the basics of providing a cot for the little one to taking the trouble to see if we needed a kettle or warmed milk etc. Otherwise the room was clean, comfortably furnished, TV had 20 odd channels with news in various languages including CNN, BBC News 24. The continental buffet breakfast was varied and more than adequate to see you through to lunchtime!! Most importantly for us, we were on the 5th floor and there was virtually no street noise in the room at night (unlike many hotels in Paris). The staff were very helpful (we had both the porter and the housekeeping supervisor ask if we needed any thing for the baby) and our questions were dealt with in a friendly manner. The location is also good - 10 mins walk from the Louvre and 2 mins from the Opera, 10 mins max to Galarie Layfayette. Many restaurants nearby offering French, Italian, Lebanese cuisine and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base, Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell_23_Fife
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend in June. The hotel was beautiful - the rooms were classy and spotless, the breakfast was lovley ( few mornigns had to ask the waiter to top things up but he was ever so efficient in doing so) the staff were helpful and friendly. It was down a quiet street, central to everything and was just round the corner from the metro. We had a fabulous time and wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Parisian Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: poodah329
Reviews.Content: The Best Western L'Horset Opera was a great place with the best location! I thoroughly researched this hotel before I selected it for a trip to Paris in which I took my mom. This was a very important trip for me as I wanted my mom to have the best time ever. The staff understood my concerns and were great and very friendly. The tourist help was great. There was one person in particular, Catherine, who was so very nice. Even though her English was limited, she would say "Hi" to my mom and I and personally bring little treats to our room. Our room was nice. The bathrooms, though luxurious, are small so be prepared. However, the room was kept spotless and was in very, very good condition -- truly the caliber of a 4 star hotel. The location was excellent! It was about a ten minute walk from the Louvre (no joke!) and close to the metro and RER lines.
