The Paris metro system is so very easy to learn so don't be intimidated to try it because you really get a chance to experience Paris in a less touristy way and most of the people there do speak a bit of English. One tip I have for travelers is to try and learn a little bit of French instead of just speaking English. Say "Bonjour" and Au revoir" instead of just saying "Hello" and go off into your questions. It is really appreciated by native Parisians and enhances your experience. Once again, this trip with my mom was unforgettable and the Best Western L'Horset Opera had a great deal to do with that. Thank you L'Horset!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at L'Horset Opera”
Reviews.Author: forensa
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this fine hotel. The staff was accommodating, the breakfast wonderful (and included) and the rooms were spotless, well decorated and appointed. My brother and I each stayed in a single room and although they were small, they were also marvels of efficient use of space. We never felt cramped and loved the updated classic decor. This hotel has recently been refurbished and they have done a great job. It was super clean and sumptuous. We had a helpful bartender in the evening who served us generous nightcaps and offered suggestions and information about the city. Whoever runs this hotel takes the job seriously! The location is wonderful, in the first arrondisement near everything including interesting side streets, and fine restaurants as well as inexpensive bistros. A testimonial to their helpfulness happened at the end of our trip. I forgot a package in my room, emailed them when I returned home and they sent it to me. Overall I am very impressed and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!! Don't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaitken
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in April. The weather was amazing and so was the hotel!! The rooms were quiet and clean. The shower was GREAT!! Never ran out of hot water!! The air condtioning was on constantly and was always set at the temperature we left it at. We had a lovely room with a balcony that looked over Rue de Antin. Call them before you arrive to request a street facing room with a balcony and they will do their best to accomodate you. Great restaurants around every corner and walking distance to every thing!! Never had any problems with pick pockets but watch for the Gypsy's...they are everywhere and all you hear is "do you speak English?? When you hear this and they hand you a note..hand it back to them and walk away!! Book your stay here and you won't be disappointed....when we go back to Paris......we will be going back to the L'Horset

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: peppermintLondon
Reviews.Content: L'horset Opera is a real find. We stayed for 2 nights on a short break in January. The location is ideal for sight-seeing, situated between Opera and the Louvre. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely - not the biggest room ever but you tend to get smallish rooms in Paris and it wasn't problematic at all - it was spotlessly clean and the breakfasts were fantastic! Finding a reasonably priced, well-located room of a high standard has proved tricky in the past but from now on we will always use L'horset for our Paris breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the L'Horset”
Reviews.Author: Linklater
Reviews.Content: It was esthetically fine, small, personal service, friendly, breakfast w/egg, ham cheese and muesli in a small room. Good coffee. The staff are mostly from Sri Lanka, and anyone who has been there, will know the excellent level of service in SRi Lanka hotels. This staff has taken that service level with them to Rue d'Antin. Especiall Fernando was so nice to us. Nice rooms and friendly receptionists. Could have wished for a sitting group - I'm asking too much... The bar was also nice, and Location, Location, Location... Within walking distance to Louvre, Latin Quarter (longish..) Beauborg (Centre Pompidou), Marais (pl. des Vosges), Galleries Lafayette, rue Royal w/many posh shops + le salon de thé "Ladurée" (an experience), the pl. Vendôme... The internet cost 45 EUR for 3 days (72 hrs) - not cheap. The hotel is not cheap cheap, but value for money. Also must agree to what they said abt. good Japanese restos around -we went to the one just across the street twice. And the Monoprix if one wants sth to eat/drink in the room, or need books, cosmetics, etc. very good assortment of everything. It'll be "our" hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: beaglefiend
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel and can't wait to stay here again. It's only a five-minute walk from the Royal Opera with tons of shops, restaurants, bakeries, bars, and ATMs in the area. It's about a 10-minute walk from the Louvre, les Galleries Lafayette (shopping), and many other popular sights. The rooms were large by European standards and very tastefully decorated in French country. We requested a double bed since it was our anniversary, so I don't know if most of their double rooms have twin beds like a lot of European hotels or not. We had a beautiful veranda that overlooked the street. The bathroom was smallish but had full tub and shower. Not much of a hair dryer, so bring your own. The room was quiet even though it faced the street (it was a quiet side street). The front desk was supremely helpful in getting us acclimated to the area on a map and suggesting area restaurants. The continental breakfast buffet was included in the hotel price and was quite nice. Numerous world newspapers and magazines were complimentary in the lobby. There was also a nice, quiet bar in the lobby. The staff at the front desk and bar spoke good English, but most of the other hotel staff did not. We enjoyed this hotel for the cleanliness, great location, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: gandg100
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for a three night stay in the centre of Paris. It's close to the Opera, Boulevard Haussmann and only a short walk to the Louvre, Place Vendome etc. Very friendly staff; Isabelle on reception was charming and very efficient. The buffet breakfast has plenty of choice; cheeses, meats, yoghurts and a range of breads. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel for the last 6 years or so on business and the service has always been first class. I have also taken my family at Christmas time and the children have always been well looked after. I have just booked again for a break with the wife and children in December. The staff particulary the bellboy/doorman I have got to know well over the years and the Hotel comes highly recommended by me. Keith Pooley

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: kathinoz
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this hotel and what a treasure it turned out to be. We stayed from 6-12 October in room 404. The room is of moderate size, smaller than an american style room and larger than european style rooms. Our 4 suticases fitted in the room with no problem. The bathrooms are granite and new with good strong water pressure from the shower and a huge tub for soaking your weary bones in. The staff all speak very good english and are ever so helpful. The subway is a 2 minute walk in front of the opera and a 5 minute walk to the huge department stores Galleries Lafayette. There are many restaurants in the area, Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Italian and around the corner is a great litte Lebanese restaurant called Tyrz and the owner is charming and speaks great english. Over the main road on Avenue L'Opera on DuMarche is a little town square with several restaurants that are fantastic. On Rue Monsigny there is a coin operated laundry for those who need to do laundry and the girl there also speaks english. This is a great hotel, great staff, European breakfast was included in the rate with an option for scrambled eggs at $4.00Euros extra for those who wish. I became very ill and the staff called in the doctor and I was in bed for last 2 days and the staff could not do enough to make my stay better. On the last day they allowed me to stay in the room til 4pm until my flight left to help me recover. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay again next year when I return.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier L'Horset Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 18, rue d'Antin | 2nd Arr., 75002 Paris, France
